contentrichtext.text: The '''Socialist Solidarity Network''' is a grouping of [[socialism|socialists]] in the [[United Kingdom]] most of whom are former members of the [[Socialist Party (England and Wales)|Socialist Party]]. They supported the [[Socialist Alliance (England)|Socialist Alliance]] in [[England]] and support the [[Scottish Socialist Party]] in [[Scotland]]. The SSN's supporters included [[Lesley Mahmood]], a long-time member of the [[Militant tendency]] and Phil Hearse, former editor of ''[[Socialist Outlook]]''. In 2002, the Network absorbed the [[Socialist Democracy Group]]. In 2003, launched the publication ''[[Socialist Resistance]]'' together with the [[International Socialist Group]]. The group ceased to function in the 2000s, as SR transformed itself into the USFI section in Britain, effectively re-absorbing some people such as Phil Hearse, while others such as Lesley Mahmood and Mandy Baker were no longer involved. ==External links== *[http://socialistresistance.org/ Socialist Resistance] {{Scottish Socialist Party}} [[Category:Trotskyist organisations of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Scottish Socialist Party]] {{UK-poli-stub}}
